ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Setting of task
Notes: e.g., behavioral, in scanner, online/at home, at computer lab, etc.

ElementDescription: session details
Task version
Notes: 1 = Shock; 2 = Reward-gain; 3= Reward-loss; 4 = Version 1; 5 = Version 2; 6= Version 3

ElementDescription: Did block involve volatile or stable condition?
Trial number
Description of stimulus 1 (e.g. cross, triangle, square, circle)
Description of stimulus 2 (e.g. cross, triangle, square, circle)
Volatility Task - On which side was stim1 presented. Counterbalanced across participants to avoid side biases.
Magnitude of stim1
Magnitude of stim2
Volatility Task - Selected stimulus option
Response randomly selected by the computer due to timeout
Notes: 1 = Computer made the choice; 0 = Participant made the choice

ElementDescription: Information whether stim1 is associated with a non-zero outcome on the current trial
Notes: 1 = Stim1 results in the non-zero outcome; 0 = Stim2 results in the non-zero outcome. Non-zero outcome = reward or shock receipt

ElementDescription: Volatility Task - Final Outcome. This will correspond to participant choice except on timeout trials.
Notes: 0= No outcome received (regardless of task version); 1= Outcome received (shock received OR loss received OR reward received)

ElementDescription: Volatility Task - Response Time (ms)
